title: Reports page shows `oops` error after reopening the App

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem 1. User is on the Reports page and backgrounds the App 2. After a while (maybe a full 15min), user reopens the App 3. User sees the Oops error page ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/abe8a3f8-4b9f-4a65-9276-276b4d65c363) ### Solution Logs show the following: ``` Got an authorization error Expensify\Error\Auth\AuthTokenExpired - 9b953676-e64d-4262-bf74-1bf0ff888e4d ~~ command: 'Search' exceptionJsonCode: '407' exceptionUserMessage: 'Your session has expired. Please sign in again.' ``` The auth token is probably expiring and we're sending a request to Search before we re-authenticate the user, which leads to the request failing and the error showing. Make sure we re-authenticate first.

title: [$250] Update unnamed workspaces with Company name from accounting integrations

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Proposal: Update unnamed workspaces with Company name from accounting integrations. Problem: when users are interacting with the product, if the workspace doesn’t have a customized name, then it becomes more confusing to users what the workspace is meant to do. Solution: If an admin has the default/unnamed workspace AND is connecting to an accounting package where the Company name is sent to us, update the workspace name. 1. Release 1: Update accounting integrations so we automatically change the name of workspace name where the user has not changed the default. 2. Release 2: Send a system message from Concierge "I updated your workspace name to match the company name from your accounting connection.” Coming from this thread: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1764109833503519?thread_ts=1762875210.606739&cid=C07HPDRELLD

title: [$250] Broken company card connection error not displayed correctly

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Blocked from attempting) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @joekaufmanexpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Convert](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1764604325203019) ## Action Performed: 1. Add a direct or Plaid card feed 2. Break the feed's connection 3. Go to the company cards page 4. Go to Wallet page 5. Go to #admins room ## Expected Result: At step 3, we should show an error message on the broken feed that prompts the admin to reconnect it. This is broken now. At step 4, we should show an error message that explains the card has a broken connection and an admin can resolve it. This is broken now. At step 5, we should display a message from concierge in #admins room explaining the company card connection is broken and link to the feed to fix it. ## Actual Result: At step 3, we show a red dot error on the feed with no message. At step 4, we show a red dot error on the card on wallet with no message. At step 5, we currently don't notify in the #admins room when a card feed connection breaks. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
## Screenshots/Videos
Add any screenshot/video evidence

title: Long suggested categories overflow the view

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

body:
Problem: When auto-categorization runs and it suggest a long category, the options run off the page so it's difficult to see what the full option is Reproduction: 1. Create a policy in NewDot 2. Add two similar but lengthy categories (like the ones in the example above) 3. Create a manual expense and submit it to the policy with a merchant name that will trigger the recommendations 4. Verify the message from Concierge shows up Solution: Have it break onto a new line so the full text is viewable

title: Remove unnecessary types from translations

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
In this PR https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/73672 we allowed translations to not need a new type per translation.

What we want to do now is:
- Remove all existing types that are only used in translations 
- Ensure we always pass the params as standalone params instead of inside an object (like we did in [this comment](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/73672/commits/257802ef77b55c7f3f5e741c25052f7b500a96c2))
